entries.meaning: (botany) One of the components of a compound leaf.

examples: The new leaflets at the end of the branch were a lighter shade of green than the mature leaves.

entries.meaning: A small sheet of paper containing information, used for dissemination of said information, often an advertisement.
examples: A leaflet had been left under the car's windshield wiper.

entries.meaning: (anatomy) A flap of a valve of a heart or blood vessel.

verbs.description: leaflet (third-person singular simple present leaflets, present participle leafleting or leafletting, simple past and past participle leafleted or leafletted)

examples: A sidewalk preacher gave an impassioned sermon while an assistant leafleted those who stayed to listen.
During the summer, Peter earned some extra cash by leafleting for a local pizza delivery restaurant.
